06_01.question: Entities are a person, place, or thing.

06_02.question: Entities are further designed with attributes.

06_03.question: An entity is the basic building block for a data model.

06_04.question: Relationships are drawn with lines showing cardinality and plurality.
06_04.explanation: Relationships show cardinality and modality. Plurality is not a thing.

A_06_05.choice: Is a use-case diagram enhanced graphically to show data and process modeling

B_06_05.choice: Is a graphical display of the processes in a business system

C_06_05.choice: Is a high-level CASE diagram of data modeling used in business systems

D_06_05.choice: Is a picture that shows the information that is created, stored, and used by a business system

E_06_05.choice: Is an illustration of external data flows to and from a business systems

06_06.question: With an ERD, the diagrams are drawn in a sequential order â€“ from top to bottom.
06_06.explanation: There's no order in an ERD.

06_07.question: On an ERD, data elements are described as singular (1:1); plurals (1:N); or didactic (M:N).
06_07.explanation: It's one-to-one (1:1), one-to-many (1:N), or many-to-many (M:N). "Singular", "Plurals", and "didatic" are made up.

06_08.question: Which would likely be an entity on a car insurance ERD?

06_09.question: In an entity called STUDENT, you might find attributes of Student-ID, Last-Name, First-Name and cell-phone.

06_10.question: Entity Relationship Diagrams show relationships between entities that are what?

E_06_10.choice: In line with the business rules and processing

06_11.question: An ERD is a picture that shows how data and information is processed and transformed by a business system.
06_11.explanation: ERD shows what data the system has, not how it's processed and transformed. That's more like a DFD.

06_12.question: Which would NOT likely be an attribute of an entity called "Student"?
06_12.explanation: A student is likely to have multiple classrooms, so there cannot be a single "Class room number" attribute.

06_13.question: A(n) _____ entity cannot exist without the presence of another entity or has an identifier that is based on another entity's attribute.

06_14.question: ERDs and DFDs are two techniques for process modeling.
06_14.explanation:
ERD = data modeling
DFD = process modeling
Not the same thing.

06_15.question: On an ERD, data elements are listed alphabetically with a cross listing to the processes that manipulate them.

06_16.question: On an ERD, processes are listed alphabetically with relationship connections drawn between processes.
06_16.explanation:
So many things wrong.
1) ERDs do not have processes. That's for DFDs.
2) Neither ERDs nor DFDs are organized alphabetically.
3) There are no relationships between processes. There have relationships between entities, and data flows between processes.

06_17.question: On an ERD, data elements are listed together and place inside boxes called entities.

A_06_18.choice: When an entity comes from an external source (aka 'external entity')

B_06_18.choice: When there is only one entity for a data process model

C_06_18.choice: When an entity can exist without the help of another entity

D_06_18.choice: Where the entity identifier is also the primary key

E_06_18.choice: When a child requires attributes from the parent

06_19.question: A data model can do what?

A_06_19.choice: Illustrate return-on-investment, break-even point, and economic feasibility

B_06_19.choice: Be used as a logical data model in analysis and as a physical data model in design

C_06_19.choice: Only be used with JAD sessions

D_06_19.choice: Only be used in BPR situations

E_06_19.choice: Represent actions or processes that occur in the to-be system

06_20.question: Relationships are some type of information that is captured about entities.
06_20.explanation: Information about entities are attributes. Relationships are more like information about the system (i.e. how entities are related).

06_21.question: During the analysis phase logical data models are created.

06_22.question: Data modeling is an iterative process.
06_22.explanation: "Work iteratively and constantly challenge the data model with business rules and exceptions to see whether the diagram is communicating the business system appropriately." (p. 189)

06_23.question: With an ERD, special symbols are added to show high-level business rules.
06_23.explanation: There are symbols on relationship lines to indicate modality (whether the relationship is 1 to 1, 1 to many, or many to many). Modality shows business rules.

06_24.question: ERDs and DFDs are two techniques for data modeling.
06_24.explanation:
ERD = data modeling
DFD = process modeling
Not the same thing.

06_25.question: An illustration of the transformation of data into business value is an ERD.

06_26.question: In adding attributes to an ERD, which of the following might NOT be a good resource for attributes?

D_06_26.choice: Through interviews (what users need for reports and processing)

06_26.explanation: The system proposal is the final deliverable of the Analysis phase, after you've done the ERD. You cannot use the system proposal to create ERDs, because it doesn't exist yet.

06_27.question: Anthony is working on the cardinality of doctors and patients in a large urban hospital. With the large number of doctors with varying specialties and patients that may have more than one aliment, he thinks the relationship might be noted as what?

06_28.question: On an ERD, data elements are grouped in a hierarchical structure that is uniquely identified by number.
06_28.explanation: There is no hierachical structure in an ERD, and entities are referred to by names (e.g. the Car entity), not ID number.

06_29.question: In creating ERD's, which would most likely NOT be a source for entities?

06_30.question: The three steps in creating an ERD are: (1) identify the entities; (2) identify the attributes; (3) identify the relationships

06_31.question: The first step to building an Entity Relationship Diagram is to do what?

A_06_31.choice: Identify data flows from the level 0 DFD diagram

B_06_31.choice: identify the attributes for each entity

D_06_31.choice: identify the processes, data flows and data stores

E_06_31.choice: draw the relationships between the entities

06_32.question: Data models can be either logical or physical.

06_33.question: The last step in creating basic ERD's is to:

06_34.question: An entity is which of the following?

B_06_34.choice: Is a person, place or thing

C_06_34.choice: Is described with a verb phrase

D_06_34.choice: Shows if it can be null or no null

E_06_34.choice: Is the association between two related processes

06_35.question: A data model is a what?

A_06_35.choice: The abstract creating of an ideal system transformation

B_06_35.choice: A formal way of representing the data that are used and created by a business system

C_06_35.choice: The expanded, thoroughly balanced and normalized use case for a system

D_06_35.choice: The mathematical model of formulas and logic used in a system

E_06_35.choice: The model that is produced by extreme programming

06_36.question: In an entity called STUDENT, you might find attributes of PROFESSOR-ID, Last-Name, First-Name and CLASSROOM.
06_36.explanation: A student is likely to have multiple professors and classrooms, so there cannot be a single "Professsor-ID" or "Classroom" attribute.

06_38.question: What type of process is creating an ERD?

06_39.question: The three major parts of an ERD diagram are what?
06_39.explanation: ERDs do not have process, data flow, data store; those are in DFDs. "Modularity" is not a thing. ERDs also have modality and cardinality, but these are properties of relationships, so they are not considered "major".

06_40.question: A data model is a formal way of representing the data that are used and created by a business system.

06_41.question: One of the most commonly used techniques for data modeling is ERDs.

06_42.question: One of the first places to start developing Entity Relationship Diagrams is by looking at the level 0 process models (DFD) and the use cases for data flows and data stores.

06_43.question: With an ERD, lines are drawn to show relationships among the data.

06_44.question: Lines on an ERD diagram indicate what?

06_45.question: A graphical illustration that shows the information that is created, stored, and used by a business system would be an ERD.

06_46.question: The three steps in creating an ERD are: (1) identify the entities; (2) identify the processes; (3) identify the relationships
06_46.explanation: There are no processes in an ERD. ERDs have entities, *attributes*, and relationships. Only DFDs have processes.

06_47.question: Jack is developing an ERD for a small dental practice office patient record system. The dental practice has three dentists, six hygienists, and many patients. A patient is always assigned to the same dentist for all appointments. In particular, he is working on the relationship between dentists and patients. Should it be which of the following?

A_06_47.choice: 1 to 1, with a modality of null

B_06_47.choice: 1 to many with a modality of null

C_06_47.choice: Many to many with a modality of null

D_06_47.choice: Many to many with a modality of not null

E_06_47.choice: 1 to many with a modality of not null

06_48.question: The lines that connect the entities are referred to as

06_49.question: With an ERD, similar kinds of information are listed together in entities.

06_51.question: An analyst can read an ERD to discover the individual pieces of information in a system and how they are organized and related to each other.

06_52.question: ERDs are drawn in several levels: Context ERD diagrams; Level 0 ERD diagrams; Level 1 ERD diagrams.
06_52.explanation: Trick question. There are context DFD, level 1 DFD, and level 2 DFD. There are no such things for ERD.

06_53.question: An entity is described by an action verb.
06_53.explanation: Entity is described by a noun. Described by an action verb is a process.

06_54.question: You have entities of ITEM, SOLD-ITEM, SALE and PAYMENT. Which most likely is NOT a relationship?
06_54.explanation: PAYMENT pays for SOLD-ITEM includes ITEM

06_55.question: Modality refers to which of the following?

A_06_55.choice: Relationships of one-to-one; one-to-many; or many-to-many

B_06_55.choice: The number of attributes generated by an entity

C_06_55.choice: Whether the entity has a unique identifier (aka 'primary key') or a concatenated identifier (aka 'composite key')

D_06_55.choice: The hierarchical structure that was developed in process models applied to data models

E_06_55.choice: Whether and entity can exist with or without a related instance in the related entity

06_56.question: During the analysis phase, analysts create programming models to represent how the business system will operate.

06_57.question: Which would NOT likely be an entity on a car insurance ERD?
06_57.explanation: Zip code would more likely be an attribute. An entity should be a person, a place, or a thing.

06_58.question: A(n) _____ entity is an entity with an identifier that describes only the entity.

06_59.question: ERDs can be quite complex and might have hundreds or thousands of entities.

06_60.question: Information in the data dictionary is called what?

06_61.question: An ERD is a picture which shows the information that is ________ by a business system.

06_63.question: On an ERD, similar kinds of information are listed together and placed inside boxes called data containers.

06_64.question: In defining the data characteristics of Universal Product Codes, we might describe them as twelve characters made up of digits â€“ numeric only.

06_65.question: Andrew, an analyst for PaxMedia Inc., has just learned that the business rules for a system he has been working on have changed. This means what?

A_07_19.choice: Andrew will be reassigned to a different project that is in its beginning stages

B_07_19.choice: The project will have to be scrapped and restarted

C_07_19.choice: The ERD data model will have to be put on hold while new DFD diagrams are created

D_07_19.choice: The ERD components will have to be changed

E_07_19.choice: Nothing â€“ once the ERD data models have been drawn, they are 'frozen' for the system

06_65.explanation: "When business rules change, the relationships or other data model components will have to be altered." (p. 189)
